cs213.photoalbum.model

Interface IPhotoModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PhotoModel

    public interface IPhotoModel
    Author:
    Mark Labrador

    Used by administrator when initiated by the CmdView class at application startup and user is not logged in.

    IPhotoModel is the interactive counterpart to this interface. It is separated to make a distinction between a model operating on a single user. This is because during interactive control operations, the operations perform in the context of a single user; the administrator does not. Since the administrator model interface can access a list of users (with getUsers), using this for the interactive model would mean the interactive controller would have access to other users with requiring user input. This violates the user-by-user specification.

    • Field Detail

      • defaultUserImgPath

        static final java.lang.String defaultUserImgPath

    • Method Detail

      • userExists

        boolean userExists(java.lang.String username)
        A utility function to help the control figure out whether the user exists or not, before trying to create him/her.
        Parameters:
        username - The id of the user to be checked.
        Returns:
        True, if the user exists. False, otherwise.

      • addUser

        IUser addUser(java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String fullName,
            java.lang.String password,
            java.lang.String userimg)
        This function attempts to add the user, if he/she doesn't already exist inside the database. Otherwise, it will return the user, if he/she already exists. If you'd like to check whether a user already has been made, use the userExists(String userId) method.
        Parameters:
        username - The id of the user you'd like to create.
        fullName - The full name of the user to be created.
        password - The password to be associated with this user.
        userimg - The file path to the user's image.
        Returns:
        The user that has just been newly created or the user that already exists in the database.

      • getUser

        IUser getUser(java.lang.String username)
        This reads users from storage into memory. If the user does not exist, this should do nothing.
        Parameters:
        username - Identifier of the desired user.

      • changeUsername

        boolean changeUsername(java.lang.String oldUsername,
                     java.lang.String newUsername)

        The function will check for existence on the old username and new username.

        Parameters:
        oldUsername - Username of the user to be altered.
        newUsername - Username the user's name is to be changed to.
        Returns:
        True, if the username was successfully changed. False, if newUsername already exists or user does not exist.

      • deleteUser

        void deleteUser(java.lang.String username)
        This deletes a user in storage. If current user is in memory, this should delete the user from memory and from storage. If the user does not exist, this should do nothing.
        Parameters:
        username - Identifier of the desired user.

      • getUsernames

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUsernames()
        Returns:
        Collection of user names.

      • getCopyOfUsers

        java.util.List<IUser> getCopyOfUsers()
        Returns:
        Returns a defensive copy of all the user objects in the model.

      • photoExists

        boolean photoExists(java.lang.String fileName)
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the photo to be checked.
        Returns:
        True, if the file exists. False, otherwise.

      • photoFileDate

        java.util.Date photoFileDate(java.lang.String fileName)
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the photo file to retrieve the last modification date of.
        Returns:
        Last modification date of the photo file or null if it doesn't exist.

      • photoFileDateString

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getDefaultUserImgPath

        java.lang.String getDefaultUserImgPath()
        Returns:
        Returns the file path to the applications default avatar for the program.

      • sortedUsers

        java.util.List<IUser> sortedUsers()
        Sorts the current userlist.
        Returns:
        Sorted defensive copy of the current list of users available in the model.
